intro: Gossypium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered cottonweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other cotton species and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It produces fluffy, white cotton-like fibers that are used in traditional textile practices. Gossypium micranthum is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
